page.title: 09Trentham Gardens.
page.content: Trentham Gardens used to be the home of the Dukes of Sutherland.At the top of the hill overlooking his 1000 acre estate stands a bronze statue of the Duke of Sutherland.Now Trentham Gardens Ltd,with John Broome as chairman owns only 500 acres of the estate the rest is owned by the N.C.B;Trentham Gardens was the first stately home to be open to the public,when people paid half a penny entrance in the early 1900's.It was a day out in the country for the children who worked in the potteries around Tunstall and Burslem.The first Trentham Hall was either formed out of the old Priory building or built on their site.In 1634 a new Hall in the Elizabethan style was built.In 1834 the 2nd Duke of Sutherland had the hall reconstructed in an Italian style from designs by Sir Charles Barry R.A. but it was demolished in 1911.
